text:
Corinne Olympios and DeMario Jackson became the center of a huge controversy earlier this summer after filming on Bachelor in Paradise was halted due to sexual misconduct allegations between the two cast members.

Although it was later determined that nothing inappropriate had occurred, the drama surrounding the incident caused production to be temporarily suspended, although it eventually resumed without Olympios and Jackson.

Videos by PopCulture.com

Despite the drama, the two appeared in good spirits when they reunited late Wednesday night leaving the Nightingale club in West Hollywood, E! News reports.

Paradise isn’t lost after all for Corinne and Demario: Will you accept this photo of their reunion? (📷: Photographer Group/Splash News) A post shared by E! News (@enews) on Aug 31, 2017 at 5:25am PDT

The two embraced as paparazzi snapped their photo

“Get a good shot, b—ches,” Olympios told photographers.

The 24-year-old also gave Jackson a kiss on the cheek, with the duo sharing another hug before going their separate ways.

“We’re friends!” Olympios told the assembled paparazzi. “We never had bad blood.”

Bachelor in Paradise contestant Amanda Stanton commented on an Instagram photo of the pair’s reunion, writing, “love this a whole lot.”

Olympios appeared in an interview with Chris Harrison this week, noting that she never blamed Jackson for the scandal.

“I honestly don’t feel like he did anything wrong,” she said. “I really just want people to know that I don’t blame DeMario. I never pointed fingers at DeMario. I never said a bad word about DeMario.”

Photo Credit: ABC
title: Corinne Olympios and DeMario Jackson Publicly Reunite for First Time Since ‘BIP’ Incident
